name: Sheet Metal Part Bending Project
description: Developed an automated sheet metal bending program using INFORM II, achieving 100 parts in 3 hours (200% of target production rate).
longDescription:
• Developed a sheet metal bending program using INFORM II programming language to execute 6 sequential bends on each part.
• Structured the robotic program into three distinct phases: picking, bending, and stacking operations.
• Implemented an adjustment table mechanism to reposition parts at optimal angles for subsequent bends, integrating the adjustment sequence directly into the bending program.
• Optimized stacking operations with reduced robot speed to ensure precise part placement and prevent damage during stacking.
• Balanced speed and precision to meet production targets of 50 parts per 4-hour cycle.
• Achieved production output of 100 parts in 3 hours, doubling the target efficiency.

name: Parallel Linkage Limit Switch Design
description: Designed and fabricated a sheet metal limit switch using parallel linkage mechanics, resolving detection and geometric compatibility issues of previous models.
longDescription:
• Designed a limit switch using parallel linkage mechanics in SolidWorks, fabricated from sheet metal.
• Optimized material usage by implementing variable thicknesses to minimize waste while maintaining structural integrity.
• Developed an in-house manufacturing solution that reduced production costs.
• Addressed limitations of previous switch models, which failed to detect parts or were incompatible with larger part geometries.
• Eliminated both detection failures and geometric compatibility issues with the new design.

name: 2025 Not-A-Boring Competition
description: Engineered a micro-scale Tunnel Boring Machine (TBM) with VFD control system and dead-reckoning navigation, achieving 3rd place in the 2025 Not-A-Boring Competition.
longDescription:
• Engineered a micro-scale Tunnel Boring Machine (TBM) for the 2025 Not-A-Boring Competition.
• Developed a control system to regulate excavation rate by adjusting the powertrain motor through a Variable Frequency Drive (VFD), ensuring optimal propulsion and excavation efficiency.
• Programmed control software to manage motor speed, output torque, and current draw via the VFD interface.
• Implemented a robust dead-reckoning-based navigation algorithm in Python for precise TBM positioning and path control.
• Designed motor, gearbox, and associated couplings in Onshape to withstand the 2200 Nm torque requirement.
• Utilized rapid prototyping to fabricate enclosures and mounts for above and below ground PCB control stations.
• Developed an advanced muck removal system incorporating a venturi pump to effectively dampen and discharge soil during excavation.
• Achieved 3rd place in the competition.

name: Custom Programming Language
description: Developed a Python-based interpreter for stack-based programs with a compiler that parses opcodes and generates p-code for execution.
longDescription:
• Developed a Python interpreter to execute stack-based programs, supporting primarily arithmetic operations.
• Designed and implemented a compiler that parses opcodes (PUSH, POP, etc.) and generates p-code for program execution.

name: 2024 Not-A-Boring-Competition Navigation Challenge
description: 1st place winning autonomous navigation system featuring React GUI, SLAM-based localization, and probabilistic path planning with 94% route accuracy.
longDescription:
• Developed a comprehensive autonomous navigation system for the Not-A-Boring Competition held in Austin, Texas.
• Built a React-based GUI that subscribes to ROS2 nodes and displays real-time data from published sources.
• Implemented a SLAM-based localization system using Python and Ultra WideBand (UWB) technology.
• Programmed a probabilistic roadmap (PRM) algorithm to generate optimal routes with 94% accuracy.
• Designed mechanical subsystem using 1/8-inch aluminum plates with machined axles and wheels.
• Fabricated custom holders for batteries, UWB modules, and motor drivers.
• Integrated electrical subsystem including emergency stop functionality, 4 lithium batteries, and 3 motor drivers.
• Achieved 1st place victory at the competition.

name: Kettle Handle
description: Designed and fabricated a mild steel safety handle for industrial kettles using Autodesk Inventor, currently deployed in manufacturing operations.
longDescription:
• Designed and fabricated a mild steel kettle handle as a safety measure for industrial kettle operations.
• Engineered the safety handle to prevent injuries from cart pushing and protect against kettle damage.
• Created detailed assembly drawings using Autodesk Inventor.
• Solution is currently in active use at the manufacturing facility.

name: Tool Stand
description: Designed and fabricated a tool stand from mild steel and sheet metal to improve ergonomics and eliminate unsafe ground-level tool storage.
longDescription:
• Designed and fabricated a tool stand from mild steel and sheet metal for safe measuring tool storage.
• Engineered the stand to eliminate dangerous ground-level tool storage practices.
• Improved ergonomics to prevent back injuries from repetitive bending during tool retrieval.
• Utilized mild steel and sheet metal construction for enhanced durability.
• Solution is currently in active use at the manufacturing facility.

name: Fixture Database Project
description: Developed a database system managing 500+ fixtures with search functionality and image upload capabilities for streamlined fixture management.
longDescription:
• Developed a database system that processes input from 500+ fixtures stored in an Excel file.
• Implemented search functionality to enable rapid location and retrieval of fixture information.
• Integrated image upload capability with dedicated interface controls for visual fixture identification.
• Designed a user-friendly interface for accessing comprehensive fixture data and associated images.

name: Unit Locator Project
description: Developed an algorithm that cross-references unit lists with prioritized units, automatically highlighting matches and flagging missing units for inventory management.
longDescription:
• Developed an algorithm that cross-references unit lists with a prioritized units list.
• Implemented highlighting functionality to identify units present on both the prioritized and master lists.
• Created a flagging system for units on the prioritized list missing from the master list, displaying them on a separate page.
• Organized highlighted units into 3 distinct pages based on unit type for improved categorization.
• Automated calculation of total quantities for each unit type on a separate Excel sheet for inventory tracking.

name: Automated Forklift Prototype
description: Constructed an autonomous forklift prototype using EV3 robotics, RobotC programming, and 3D printed components with automated object detection.
longDescription:
• Constructed an autonomous forklift prototype using EV3 robotics and RobotC programming.
• Created detailed flowcharts to map out robot path planning strategies.
• Implemented automatic object detection and lifting logic algorithms.
• Programmed autonomous behaviors using RobotC for complete system automation.
• Integrated EV3 mechanics with 3D printed components for stable operation.
• Designed forklift system to autonomously lift, hold, and drop objects at designated checkpoints.

name: Traffic Light System
description: Developed an Arduino-based 4-way intersection traffic control system with crosswalk functionality and train detection capabilities.
longDescription:
• Developed an Arduino-based traffic light system that simulates a 4-way stop intersection with crosswalk and train functionality.
• Designed and implemented a complete 4-way intersection traffic control system.
• Integrated crosswalk functionality with dedicated pedestrian signals.
• Implemented train detection and warning system for enhanced safety.
• Programmed traffic light sequencing logic using Arduino.
• Fabricated physical structure using cardboard and scrap materials (excluding wiring and LEDs).
• Soldered all electrical connections and integrated system components.
